topic.title: How to deal with very big databases on ZeroNet?
topic.body:
What if my site needs a big database (let's say > 1GB of json data) to function?
Noone would download integrally such a big amount of data locally.
Is it possible to distribute it someway (e.g. in a DHT) or, more generally, what is the suggested way to deal with that?

topic.title: How does the update of cloned sites work?
topic.body:
Let's suppose I cloned ZeroTalk and today ZeroTalk was updated.
What should be the expected output for my zite?

I mean, will I receive a notification with the diff of the changes or I should check periodically if something was changed and update my zite accordingly?

*Edit*: And what if I changed some of the html or css files?
I couldn't find any mention of such process in the documentation whatsoever.

Also, is there a ZeroTalk for Developers?

topic.title: Sites without authenticated users
Can I send my sites to others even if my port is closed?
topic.body: For example, can you see http://127.0.0.1:43110/12PeviTvcxyEp938HoTuoEkVJ7QSmPZboy/?Home , which is my newly created blog?

topic.title: Receive updates for site without seeding their content
topic.body:
Suppose I'd like to receive updates for a site (for example because I have a script that checks a list of sites to categorize them) but I don't want to seed their contents because some (many) may have illicit content.
Is there a way (even tricky / hackish) to do it?

I mean, it seems to me that if I click on "Stop site" from 0Hello, I will also stop receiving updates. Is this right?

1526239496_1NEAivkF2GyHcnRQfJjahZD5XyWfJ.body:
> [thunder33345](#comment_54_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): Why not explain why is the 1gb of json data needed?

It is a database with large amount of objects (some hundred millions).
It is *not* needed for photos or videos, in case you were wondering.

> [thunder33345](#comment_58_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): you COULD store them as optional bigfiles if it's not really needed

Sorry, maybe I've not stated it clearly: Such data *is* necessary for the site to work properly.

Just one question: If I store them as optional bigfiles will I be able to import them to the SQLite database, when the user requires it?

> [eibriel](#comment_52_1BYU9zV786auJ29dF3HMAQYhxA2WgN4ofi): You can subdivide it in smaller pieces, with some sort of index. And make each piece optional.Then you load only the pieces needed for the user, each user will get / download a different set of pieces according to its usage. [...]

This is indeed a good way to do it.
May not be fully satisfying but I think I will go for it.

If I use such an optional piece, can I import it into the SQLite database at a later time?

I obtained something that seems to be working and I'd like to ask others to have a confirm that I'm not sharing my own sites: can someone please check if they can visit [http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Emeb2gK3PKqpBeCwiMTsDsZjLcoWAwJRj]() ?
(It is only a blank innocuous site).

I'd like to point out what seems to be current state of this:
* Files with non whitelisted extensions aren't donwloaded
* Files which locally have timestamp greater than peers' ones are *not* sent (this also means that any content that I create on e.g. ZeroTalk is not published)
* I'm already unsure about new sites. **Can you please help me by seeing if you can visit the site above?**.

Thank you very much.

What follows is the patch file based on commit `b6bf38b8` which is the actual master for ZeroNet.
I hope it will be useful to others as well. *Please note that this is only in case someone also wants to create a classifier or another "research project" and you can not publish content to other peers. It is unethical to use this to act as "leech only"*.
```

+allowed_extensions = [".json", ".html", ".htm", ".css", ".js", ".txt", ".json-default", ".html-default", ".htm-default", ".css-default", ".js-default", ".txt-default"]
+def safe_file (file_path):
+    _, file_extension = os.path.splitext(file_path)
+    return file_extension in allowed_extensions
 
 @PluginManager.acceptPlugins

@@ -282,15 +287,18 @@ class Site(object):

             self.log.debug(
                 "File size %s too large: %sMB > %sMB, skipping..." %
@@ -717,6 +731,9 @@ class Site(object):
         elif self.settings["serving"] is False:  # Site not serving
```
